data.title: Enhancement: Don't prompt/confirm when deleting empty files
data.body:
This is one subtle, but really nice behavior of Sublime. When creating files sometimes I get the name wrong and, for whatever reason, I'd rather delete the file and re-create than just rename it. Atom adds friction by prompting "Are you sure you want to delete the selected item?" – this gets old. There's no real consequence for deleting an empty file, so the prompt would be great to remove. Adjusting the behavior would also be great when removing files you don't end up needing after scaffolding a project.

TLDR: the prompt gets to be a bit much.

data.title: OSX: Inconsistent cmd+D behavior
data.body:
**Operating system**: OSX El Capitan v10.11.2 (15C50)
**Atom**: v1.3.2

**Description of problem**:

`cmd+D` does not always work as intended. The expected behavior is that it selects the next instance of the highlighted occurrence. For instance, if `sandwiches` is selected, and `cmd+D` is entered, then the next instance of `sandwiches` should be selected. There should be no circumstance where any text aside from `sandwiches` become highlighted after typing `cmd+D`.

Sometimes – seemingly when `D` is pressed too quickly after pressing `cmd` – Atom gets confused and highlights _up until_ the next instance of the text.

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Update: [Follow the steps here](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10312#issuecomment-170034796)**
# 

Here are some screenshots:

**Expected behavior**

To reproduce these screenshots, press `cmd` and then `d` with at least 100ms of timing between them.

Image 1: this is after pressing `cmd+D` once:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2322305/12161839/ac9c2d48-b4c8-11e5-891c-3ceb684ef8f0.png)

Image 2: this is after pressing `cmd+D` twice:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2322305/12161828/932d761e-b4c8-11e5-9e89-ffa9dc4c552f.png)

**Unexpected behavior**

To reproduce these screenshots, type `cmd` and then `D` very quickly. A non-scientific guess is to try to get it down to ~5ms between them.

Image 1: this is after pressing `cmd+D` once:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2322305/12161857/cbb63c3c-b4c8-11e5-8968-28c4dc6a7d58.png)

Image 2: this is after pressing `cmd+D` twice:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2322305/12161860/d3600ea4-b4c8-11e5-90d9-64c93db8d820.png)

Is this a bug, or is it intention behavior where it functions differently when the keys are pressed too closely together? I've used Sublime Text for years, and I use this hotkey so frequently that I type it very, very quickly; ST behaves the same way whether there's an appreciable delay or not.

data.title: OSX: Crashes when closed as full screen app
data.body:
https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/9584 is once again a problem in 1.3.2. I'm filing a new issue based on https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/9584#issuecomment-167817650

**Operating system**: OSX El Capitan v10.11.2 (15C50)
**Atom**: v1.3.2

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open Atom
2. Make it full screen
3. Close Atom by clicking the "x" button in the upper left hand corner of the app, or via cmd+Q
4. Atom should crash. If not, repeat steps 1 through 4 until it does (shouldn't take more than a few tries!)

Crash data [here](https://gist.github.com/jmeas/e52b40212d2b57dcd375)

data.title: Handle EAGAIN and ETIMEDOUT errors on open/save
data.body:
Also extract helper for mapping error codes to friendly messages

/cc @kevinsawicki 

Closes #10299 
Closes #10300

data.title: Problems with accented characters in syntax highlighting
data.body:
It looks like we may have a problem with accented characters with syntax highlighting. We have [a report](https://discuss.atom.io/t/accents-breaks-syntax-highlighting/24263/6?u=leedohm) that describes this as being a problem in:
- JS
- HTML
- PHP
- CSS

If this can be verified, we should probably do an audit to ensure that all languages that allow UTF-8 encodings utilize regular expressions that recognize the proper character sets. This especially holds true for text or markup languages like HTML.

/cc @atom/languages

data.title: Hang when overwriting open file with new file
data.body:
Atom hangs whenever I try to save to the same location as that of an open file.

**Reproduction Steps:**
1.  Open any file `F`.
2.  Create new file `G`.
3.  Write anything (or nothing) in `G`.
4.  Make sure `F` is one of the open tabs.
5.  Save `G` to same location as `F`.

**Expected Behavior:**

Writing `G` to `F` and closing `F`.

**Observed Behavior:**

Atom hangs indefinitely.

**Atom version:** 1.3.0
**OS and version:** Kubuntu 15.10

**Installed packages:**
├── autocomplete-glsl@0.2.3
├── character-table@0.4.3
├── git-plus@5.5.0
├── hex@0.6.2
├── language-fish-shell@1.0.2
├── language-glsl@2.0.1
├── language-latex@0.6.1
├── language-lua@0.9.4
├── language-x86-64-assembly@2.1.5
├── latex-completions@0.3.0
├── linter@1.11.3
├── linter-lua@1.0.1
├── markdown-format@2.5.1
├── markdown-wiki@0.0.0 **(Personal; issue still arises when disabled)**
├── minimap@4.16.0
├── minimap-git-diff@4.1.8
├── save-session@0.15.7
├── seti-syntax@0.4.1
├── seti-ui@0.8.1
└── sort-lines@0.12.0

**Additional information:**
-   **Problem happens in safe mode**
-   **Problem is consistent**
-   **Problem happens with all files**

data.title: high CPU usage with spell checker (Mac)
data.body:
When I open several files with many non-dictionary words (e.g. codewords), the Apple spell checker sucks up a lot of CPU for a long time. This happened quite a number of times for me. I can't send you the files due to sensitivity. 

Is there a way to turn off spell checking? 

![screen shot 2016-01-06 at 11 41 13 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/742503/12146573/485226ba-b4cf-11e5-9f2d-1babc69868b2.png)

data.title: Disconnect in observeTextEditors contract?
data.body:
See https://github.com/atom/wrap-guide/pull/52

The way I always understood `observeTextEditors` to work is that the callback would be called whenever a new `TextEditor` was created. But as @JD342 points out, it may work a little differently in practice. This may cause more bugs than just the one the above PR is intended to fix. We should evaluate whether we should fix the documentation or the implementation or both.

data.title: Crashes when opening the same file in two split panes
data.body:
When I try to open the same file in a split window on both sides, the application stops responding and I have to force a restart. I can reproduce this behavior consistently in the application. The files are JavaScript, if that matters.

OS X 10.11.2
Atom 1.3.2

All plugins are disabled.

[Atom_2016-01-06-073202_Logans-MacBook-Pro.txt](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/79847/Atom_2016-01-06-073202_Logans-MacBook-Pro.txt)

data.title: Menu ordering on OS X doesn't match system patterns
data.body:
On OS X, most apps have a similar pattern of menus:

![screenshot of safari 7-01-16 12-02-28 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/811954/12141142/f326b0e0-b4d1-11e5-869c-400c40fbaf46.png)

![screenshot of iterm2 7-01-16 12-02-41 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/811954/12141149/fb8e1494-b4d1-11e5-83eb-1474d43081f8.png)

![screenshot of finder 7-01-16 12-02-52 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/811954/12141151/030087ac-b4d2-11e5-89cd-33c7d0b7250b.png)

![screenshot of mail 7-01-16 12-03-29 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/811954/12141163/1ad9f2aa-b4d2-11e5-8a14-2edb081d7863.png)

![screenshot of textedit 7-01-16 12-03-58 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/811954/12141171/2e8bee16-b4d2-11e5-9f5f-e06cf8f07584.png)

The general pattern is: File, Edit, (Format), View, Application menus, Window, Help. However Atom uses File, Edit, Selection, Find, View, Packages, Window, Help. 

![screenshot of atom 7-01-16 12-04-22 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/811954/12141230/a8dec562-b4d2-11e5-8282-814b3d12474a.png)

I think View should probably be next to File and Edit. 

Apologies if this is a duplicate, I tried searching but I couldn't find anything.

data.title: Merging tabs after splitting panes results in editor crash
data.body:
When merging tabs back into each other after opening the same file twice, the editor becomes non-responsive and has to be closed.

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Open file.
2. Right click file tab -> Split Right
3. Add a character to one of the two panes, making the file modified. Don't save.
4. Drag right tab on top of left tab.

**Expected behavior:**

Right tab disappears, as the file doesn't need to be open twice.

**Observed behavior:**

Most of the time, the editor will lock up, become unresponsive then present the error dialog allowing me to close it some seconds later.

**Atom version:** 1.3.0
**OS and version:** Linux Mint 17.2

**Installed packages:**

(via `apm list`
/home/toby/.atom/packages (16)
├── coverage@0.6.1
├── file-icons@1.6.13
├── highlight-selected@0.11.1
├── language-haml@0.23.14
├── linter@1.11.3
├── linter-coffeelint@1.1.2
├── linter-haml@1.1.0
├── linter-jshint@1.2.2
├── linter-rubocop@0.4.7
├── linter-ruby@1.2.1
├── merge-conflicts@1.3.7
├── rubocop-auto-correct@1.1.0
├── sync-settings@0.6.0
├── synced-sidebar@0.4.3
├── tasks@2.6.0
└── todo-show@1.3.0

**Other info**
As this is a pane related bug, it may be worth noting that I have the **Destroy empty panes** option **disabled**, although the bug manifests when you have multiple files in each pane open so I can't really imagine it's related to pane destruction (or lack thereof).

**Comments:**

This happens about 80% of the time, other times nothing seems to happen and the right hand tab doesn't disappear (this could be me simply dragging the tab across wrong, haven't had time to exhaustively investigate.

I understand this is a fairly bizarre thing to do in isolation but if you use the split X commands without keeping a close eye on what's open you can naturally end up with multiple copies of the same file open. And then when you intend to "rebalance" what's in each pane you end up performing this and having to reset Atom.

Happy to provide more information if needed, and thanks for reading.

data.title: Uncaught Error: ETIMEDOUT: connection timed out, mkdir '/Volumes/www-3/sandbox/api/cities'
data.body:
Weird error, from a very specific use case.
My MBP is connected via cable to a Windows server which disconnect from time to time. When i connect to it again, i have to save/replace the file on the newly re-mounted distant folder.

Doing this for the last 3 days, then i got this error.

**Atom Version**: 1.3.2
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.2
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: ETIMEDOUT: connection timed out, mkdir '/Volumes/www-3/sandbox/api/cities'


data.title: Uncaught Error: EAGAIN: resource temporarily unavailable, open '/Volumes/d$/ToC/Attribution/Horiz...
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. In Finder I right clicked a file and chose Atom 1.2.4 in the open with menu (it says Atom 1.2.4 in the open with menu but i have Atom 1.3.2)
2. Error came up in Atom 1.3.2 which i already had open with multiple tabs.

NOTE: The file I opened is on a network share and is a 3.2MB csv file over a VPN connection so there are a million things that could have caused this, however, I was able to successfully open the same file immediately after getting this error via the File->Open menu.

**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.2

data.title: File > New File fails if no window is focused
data.body:
_(Atom 1.3.2 on OS X 10.11.2)_

**Expected behavior**
Selecting `File > New File` in the menu bar (or pressing <kbd>⌘</kbd>+<kbd>n</kbd>) opens a new file (and a new window if necessary).

**Observed behavior**
Either method produces no result if there is not a window already open and focused (this includes having open but minimized windows).

data.title: Opening files that use atom:// URIs create fake folders
data.body:
Opening Settings or any other file that uses a URI will cause a fake folder to appear in the Tree View (eg config, init-script) and `Settings - atom://config` or similar to show up in the titlebar. Reproduce by using a new window.

Tested using safe mode and also reported in #10194, atom/tree-view#690.

data.title: No font subpixel antialiasing on OS X with retina display
data.body: I noticed that Atom doesn't use subpixel font rendering on OS X El Capitan with a retina display. I've tried setting `-webkit-font-smoothing` to `subpixel-antialiased`, `antialiased` and `auto` in my stylesheet but all of them use grayscale antialiasing, not subpixel antialiasing. Here's an example of how text looks like in TextEdit, with subpixel antialiasing (top), and the same in Atom, with the One Light themes and all settings at default (bottom): I initially [reported this on the Atom support forum](https://discuss.atom.io/t/how-to-enable-font-subpixel-antialiasing/24185). According to a reply, this happens because Chromium doesn't use subpixel antialiasing on Retina displays. So, is there any way to enable subpixel antialiasing or does Chromium completely prevent this?

data.title: Atom hangs when using tree view if similar filename tab already open
data.body:
When working with ansible projects, you end up with a lot of similar filenames nested in various folders with common file names. There appears to be a situation that causes Atom to hang.
### System
- Version: 1.3.2
- OS: OS X 10.11.2
- Occurs with community packages disabled?: YES
- Community packages: 
  - atom-beautify@0.28.19
  - language-actionscript3@0.3.0
  - linter@1.11.3
  - linter-jshint@1.2.2
  - linter-pylint@1.2.0
  - mac-fix-path@0.0.0
  - merge-conflicts@1.3.7
  - minimap@4.19.0
  - tab-control@0.6.8
### Preparation Steps

Make this ansible file/folder structure (each leaf is a filename):
- repos/category/repository/inventory/hosts
- repos/category/repository/roles/role-a/defaults/main.yml
- repos/category/repository/roles/role-a/tasks/main.yml
- repos/category/repository/roles/role-b/subrole-c/defaults/main.yml
- repos/category/repository/roles/role-b/subrole-c/tasks/main.yml
### Steps
1. Open Atom to the `repos` directory
2. Open: repos/category/repository/roles/role-b/subrole-c/tasks/main.yml
3. Open: repos/category/repository/roles/role-b/subrole-c/defaults/main.yml
4. Open: repos/category/repository/roles/role-a/defaults/main.yml
### Expected behavior

Open these files without hanging Atom.

data.title: Atom crashing on OS X after closing window
data.body:
Lately, after I close an Atom window with a project (another window with another project is open on another screen) entire Atom crashes.

```
Crashed Thread:        0  CrBrowserMain  Dispatch queue: com.apple.main-thread

Exception Type:        EXC_BAD_ACCESS (SIGSEGV)
Exception Codes:       KERN_INVALID_ADDRESS at 0x0000000000000000
```

Entire OS X crashlog: http://pastebin.com/snrr14Am

data.title: Atom freezes when dragging file to split where same file is already opened
data.body:
Atom freezes when dragging file to split where it is already opened

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Open up atom and create a new file, i.e. test.txt
2. Save this file and open up a vertical split.
3. The same file 'test.txt' is now opened in the new split.
4. Now drag the file in the left split to the right split.
5. Atom freezes.

**Expected behavior:**

The tab that is moved to the other split should merge with the target tab.

**Observed behavior:**

Atom freezes.

**Screenshots and GIFs**

http://take.ms/MYOv7

**Atom version:** 1.3.2
**OS and version:** OSX 10.11.2

**Installed packages:**

atom-beautify@0.28.19
atom-handlebars@1.3.0
atom-solarized-dark-ui@0.25.0
git-plus@5.9.0
highlight-selected@0.11.1
jshint@1.8.3
language-python-django-templates@0.1.0
linter@1.11.3
linter-flake8@1.9.3
linter-jslint@10.0.0
linter-php@1.1.6
linter-pylint@1.2.0
linter-ruby@1.2.1
minimap@4.19.0
minimap-highlight-selected@4.3.1
project-manager@2.6.5
solarized-dark-ui@0.3.1
tomorrow@1.0.0
vim-mode@0.64.0

**Additional information:**
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: Yes
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: Unknown
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Yes

data.title: Listening to window.toggle-full-screen using atom.commands.onWillDispatch does not retain originalEvent
data.body:
_Atom 1.3.2, Ubuntu 12.04_

Run the following in the console:

``` js
atom.commands.onWillDispatch(function (e) {console.log(e.originalEvent)})
```

When using the default <kbd>F11</kbd> to trigger `window.toggle-full-screen` the `originalEvent` property is not set like with other keybindings.

Output:

```
(left)
KeyboardEvent {}

(home)
KeyboardEvent {}

(F11)
undefined
```

data.title: Reindexing stuck in loop when there are symlinks to project directories
data.body:
Symlinks in the project pointing to directories within the project cause atom to get stuck in a loop (case 1) or report duplicate search matches (case 2).
### Case 1

Say there are the following entries in the project:

```
dir1
dir1/dir2
dir1/dir2/file1
dir1/dir2/symlink1 -> ..
```

The `symlink1` points to the parent directory. This creates a loop in the project filesystem and causes several issues:
- Atom gets stuck in a loop when reindexing the project. The reindexing will never finish
- When searching for matches within the project atom will again get stuck in a loop and keep reporting matches in the same files over and over
### Case 2

Consider the following project entries:

```
dir1
dir1/dir2
dir1/dir2/test.txt
symlink1-> dir1/dir2
```

In this case the `symlink1` points to a project directory further down the three. As a result the file test.txt is encountered **twice** when traversing the filesystem tree and any search matches will be reported twice.
### Fix

I think this should be handled cleanly by checking the target of symlinks in the project. If they point to other directories within the project they should not be followed when traversing the tree during reindexing/searching.
